item.title: Geometric series
item.description: Geometric Series I was doing a little work on the geometric series in class today, and then found a nice application for it in math club. The post summarizes it. In math class I dealt with the two formulas $$\sum_{k=0}^{n}r^k=\frac{1-r^{n+1}}{1-r}$$ und $$\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}r^k=\frac{1}{1-r},|r|<1.$$ The first can be proved by induction. The inductionstep looks like this. $$\sum_{k=0}^{n+1}r^k=\sum_{k=0}^{n}r^k + r^{n+1}=\frac{1-r^{n+1}}{1-r} + r^{n+1} = \frac{1-r^{n+1} + (1-q)r^{n+1}}{1-r} = \frac{1-r^{n+1} + r^{n+1} - r^{n+2}}{1-r} $$ $$= \frac{1 - r^{n+2}}{1-r}.
